intro: Swertia leucantha, commonly known as white swertia, is a perennial herb native to the Himalayas and parts of southern Asia. It belongs to the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas at high elevations. Swertia leucantha is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
